library.description: Numeral.js is a tiny JS library for formatting and manipulating numbers.  Formats include number of decimals, currency, percentages, time, and more. It is lightweight, easy to localize, has no dependencies, and is available for use in the browser as well as node.js.
library.name: Numeral.js

library.description: Tangle is a JavaScript library for creating reactive documents. Your readers can interactively explore possibilities, play with parameters, and see the document update immediately. Tangle is super-simple and easy to learn.
library.name: Tangle

library.description:
Numeric Javascript is a javascript library for doing numerical analysis in the browser. Because Numeric Javascript uses only the javascript programming language, it works in many browsers and does not require powerful servers.

Numeric Javascript is for building "web 2.0" apps that can perform complex calculations in the browser and thus avoid the latency of asking a server to compute something. Indeed, you do not need a powerful server (or any server at all) since your web app will perform all its calculations in the client.
library.name: Numeric Javascript

library.description: Numbers provides a comprehensive set of mathematical tools that currently are not offered in JavaScript. These tools include basic calculations, calculus, matrix operations, prime numbers, statistics and then some.
library.name: numbers.js

library.description: Sylvester is a vector, matrix and geometry library for JavaScript, that runs in the browser and on the server side. It includes classes for modelling vectors and matrices in any number of dimensions, and for modelling infinite lines and planes in 3-dimensional space. It lets you write object-oriented easy-to-read code that mirrors the maths it represents.
library.name: Sylvester

library.description:
Science.js is a JavaScript library for scientific and statistical computing.

Currently, there are two modules:

science.stats, containing various implementations of statistical methods similar to those provided by R;
science.lin, for linear algebra.
library.name: Science.js

library.description: A Javascript library for arbitrary-precision arithmetic.
library.name: bignumber.js

library.description: Math.js is an extensive math library for JavaScript and Node.js. It features a flexible expression parser and offers an integrated solution to work with numbers, big numbers, complex numbers, units, and matrices.
library.name: math.js

library.description:
Scheme arithmetic library for JavaScript. This implementation provides all functions listed in the R6RS Scheme specification, Section 11.7, along with "eqv?" from Section 11.5. ("eqv?" uses JavaScript's "===" to compare non-numbers.)

Exact numbers support the standard ECMA Number formatting methods
(toFixed, toExponential, and toPrecision) without a fixed upper limit
to precision.
library.name: javascript-bignum

library.description: BigInteger provides a way to represent large numbers accurately in JavaScript.
library.name: BigInteger

library.description: TSM is a a collection of vector and matrix classes written in Microsoft's new JavaScript superset TypeScript, which compiles to plain JavaScript.
library.name: TSM

library.description: CryptoJS is a growing collection of standard and secure cryptographic algorithms implemented in JavaScript using best practices and patterns. They are fast, and they have a consistent and simple interface.
library.name: CryptoJS

library.description: accounting.js is a tiny JavaScript library for number, money and currency formatting, with optional excel-style column rendering (to line up symbols and decimals). It's lightweight, fully localisable and has zero dependencies.
library.name: accounting.js

library.description:
Have you ever felt that 64-bit was not enough for you?

The answer is here, at least for basic arithmetic. longdouble.js implements double-double arithmetic which represents numbers as a sum of two javascript 64-bit floats.

This representation allows us to be reasonably fast and still be high-precision.
library.name: longdouble.js

library.description:
Offers a extremely high precision level to make mathematical operations. For integers there is no limits and for floating point numbers, the class allows setting the maximum precision. 
Created: 2006.05.03 - Modified 2009.07.16
library.name: Big Number

library.description:
An Google Closure ready implementation of sylvester vector and matrix math library

A rewrite of sylvester vector and matrix math library (http://sylvester.jcoglan.com/) using google closure compiler annotations for javascript optimizations.
library.name: SylvesterClosure

library.description: Generate random numbers that are consecutively unique.
library.name: unique-random

library.description: Javascript Toolkit for Game Devs. This is not a game engine but a math library. This solves writing the same math formulas over and over. Rift is similar to the Math class, it has no state and its global.
library.name: rift

library.description: vector.js is a small module to facilitate limited 3D vector arithmetics based on unsigned 8 bit integers (UInt8). The module emulates operator overloading in JavaScript and show its limitations in the context of an included tutorial and well documented sources.
library.name: vector.js

library.description: Tired of inprecise numbers represented by doubles? Have a look at Fraction.js, which represents rational numbers as two integers in the form of n / d.
library.name: Fraction.js

library.description: A JavaScript library for numerical mathematics: special functions of complex numbers, numerical linear algebra, quadrature, statistical functions and plotting.
library.name: Jmat.js

library.description: A jQuery plugin for creating web based calculator, it will parse excel-like formula based on predefined cells and values
library.name: jQuery Calx

library.description: JavaScript Statistics and Math Library
library.name: JavaScript Statistics and Math Library

library.description: jStat is a statistical library written in JavaScript that allows you to perform advanced statistical operations without the need of a dedicated statistical language (i.e. MATLAB or R).
library.name: jStat

library.description:
MathJax is an open source JavaScript display engine for mathematics that works in all modern browsers.

No more setup for readers. No more browser plugins. No more font installations… It just works.
library.name: MathJax
JSM - JavaScript Matrix library

library.description: A comprehensive library for low-level math, analytic, and computational geometry
library.name: CompGeoJS

library.description: Arbitrary precision binary operations library for Javascript.
library.name: funary

library.description: Build, display, and solve algebraic equations in JavaScript.
library.name: algebra.js

library.description: MathLib.js is a JavaScript library for doing mathematical computations in a browser.
library.name: MathLib.js

library.description: Creates objects that generate number sequences
library.name: numgen

library.description: A symbolic math parser written in javascript.
library.name: nerdamer

library.description: Digital Logic Circuit Simulation library in javascript.
library.name: DLCS

library.description:
This plugin is a number formatting and parsing plugin for jQuery.

Number formatting is likely familiar to anyone who's worked with server-side code like Java or PHP and who has worked with internationalization. People who aren't stuck in the US-centric frame of mind can quickly point out that people in other parts of the world don't format their numbers in the same way as Americans. For example, a number that we would write in the US as "1,250,500.75" would be written differently in different countries: "1.250.500,75" in Germany, "1 250 500,75" in France, and "1'250'500.75" in Switzerland, and "125,0500.75" in Japan. The number is exactly the same, but it's just written using a different format when presented to users of the web application.
library.name: jquery-numberformatter
